sourcing.instructions: Erbium oxide (Er2O3) from chemical supply companies, Molybdenum oxide (MoO3) from metallurgical suppliers, Oxygen (O2) from industrial gas suppliers, Yttrium oxide (Y2O3) from chemical suppliers.
steps: Erbium oxide (Er2O3) from chemical supply companies, Molybdenum oxide (MoO3) from metallurgical suppliers, Oxygen (O2) from industrial gas suppliers, Yttrium oxide (Y2O3) from chemical suppliers.

1. Weigh out 5.00 g of Erbium oxide (Er2O3), 1.00 g of Molybdenum oxide (MoO3), 12.00 g of Yttrium oxide (Y2O3), and 1.00 g of Oxygen (O2). 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine the Erbium oxide and Molybdenum oxide and mix thoroughly using a spatula. 3. Gradually add Yttrium oxide to the mixture while continuing to stir. 4. Finally, introduce the Oxygen gas slowly while mixing to ensure even distribution.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 5.00 g of Erbium oxide (Er2O3), 1.00 g of Molybdenum oxide (MoO3), 12.00 g of Yttrium oxide (Y2O3), and 1.00 g of Oxygen (O2). 2. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine the Erbium oxide and Molybdenum oxide and mix thoroughly using a spatula. 3. Gradually add Yttrium oxide to the mixture while continuing to stir. 4. Finally, introduce the Oxygen gas slowly while mixing to ensure even distribution.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible. 2. Heat the crucible in a muffle furnace at 1200°C for 6 hours to ensure complete reaction and solidification.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible. 2. Heat the crucible in a muffle furnace at 1200°C for 6 hours to ensure complete reaction and solidification.

steps: Allow the furnace to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 3-4 hours) to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: Allow the furnace to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 3-4 hours) to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible once cooled. 2. Sand the edges and surfaces lightly to achieve a smooth finish. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance surface stability if required.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible once cooled. 2. Sand the edges and surfaces lightly to achieve a smooth finish. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to enhance surface stability if required.
